Apple___Apple_scab.title: Apple — Apple scab
Apple___Apple_scab.description: A fungal disease causing olive-green to brown scabby lesions on leaves and fruit; favored by cool, wet weather. Remove fallen leaves and apply appropriate fungicides during wet periods.

Apple___Black_rot.title: Apple — Black rot
Apple___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease that causes circular dark fruit lesions and leaf spots; sanitation and pruning of infected wood helps reduce inoculum.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.title: Apple — Cedar apple rust
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: A fungal disease requiring both apple and cedar hosts; orange gelatinous spore horns on leaves in wet weather are typical signs. Remove nearby junipers and apply protective sprays.

Apple___healthy.title: Apple — Healthy
Apple___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Maintain balanced nutrition, regular monitoring, and good pruning practices.

Blueberry___healthy.title: Blueberry — Healthy
Blueberry___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Keep soil acidic and provide consistent moisture and nutrients for optimal fruiting.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.title: Cherry — Powdery mildew
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery fungal growth on leaves and shoots, often in humid but not saturated conditions. Prune for airflow and apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate treatments if needed.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.title: Cherry — Healthy
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Ensure good sanitation and nutrient balance for healthy trees.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.title: Corn — Cercospora / Gray leaf spot
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Fungal leaf spots that reduce photosynthetic area and yield; use resistant varieties, crop rotation, and fungicides when necessary.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.title: Corn — Common rust
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves caused by rust fungi; generally managed with resistant hybrids and by avoiding prolonged leaf wetness.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.title: Corn — Northern leaf blight
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Long, elliptical tan lesions on leaves often caused by Exserohilum turcicum; manage with resistant varieties and fungicide applications under high disease pressure.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.title: Corn — Healthy
Corn_(maize)___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Maintain balanced fertility and irrigation practices.

Grape___Black_rot.title: Grape — Black rot
Grape___Black_rot.description: A fungal disease causing dark, circular lesions on leaves and fruit; sanitation and timely fungicide programs reduce spread.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).title: Grape — Esca (Black Measles)
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: A complex trunk disease leading to discolored fruit and vine decline; focus on sanitation, removal of infected wood, and cultural controls.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.title: Grape — Leaf blight (Isariopsis)
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Fungal leaf spots that reduce canopy health; avoid overhead irrigation and apply copper-based controls when necessary.

Grape___healthy.title: Grape — Healthy
Grape___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Provide balanced nutrients and good canopy management.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).title: Orange — Huanglongbing (Citrus greening)
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: A bacterial disease transmitted by psyllids, causing yellowing, misshapen fruit, and tree decline; manage vectors and follow local eradication guidelines.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.title: Peach — Bacterial spot
Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial lesions on leaves and fruit that reduce quality; copper-based sprays and avoiding overhead irrigation help control spread.

Peach___healthy.title: Peach — Healthy
Peach___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Maintain good fertilization and pruning practices.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.title: Bell Pepper — Bacterial spot
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial lesions on fruit and foliage that can reduce yield; use certified seed, practice sanitation, and apply allowed bactericides.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.title: Bell Pepper — Healthy
Pepper,_bell___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Provide even moisture and balanced feeding for best production.

Potato___Early_blight.title: Potato — Early blight
Potato___Early_blight.description: Concentric ring leaf spots on older foliage caused by Alternaria species; remove affected debris and consider protective fungicides.

Potato___Late_blight.title: Potato — Late blight
Potato___Late_blight.description: Rapidly spreading blight causing dark lesions and tuber rot (Phytophthora infestans); use certified seed, good drainage, and timely fungicides.

Potato___healthy.title: Potato — Healthy
Potato___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Maintain balanced soil nutrition and good crop hygiene.

Raspberry___healthy.title: Raspberry — Healthy
Raspberry___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Ensure good pruning and site selection to reduce disease pressure.

Soybean___healthy.title: Soybean — Healthy
Soybean___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Follow recommended rotations and nutrient management for healthy stands.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.title: Squash — Powdery mildew
Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: White powdery patches on leaves and stems common in warm, dry days with high humidity at night; apply potassium bicarbonate or remove infected tissue.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.title: Strawberry — Leaf scorch
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Leaf scorch leads to browning and reduced leaf area, often fungal or environmental; remove badly affected plants and consider appropriate fungicide treatments.

Strawberry___healthy.title: Strawberry — Healthy
Strawberry___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Use balanced feeding and mulch to protect fruit quality.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.title: Tomato — Bacterial spot
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial lesions on leaves and fruit reduce marketability; practice sanitation and use copper sprays where permitted.

Tomato___Early_blight.title: Tomato — Early blight
Tomato___Early_blight.description: Concentric lesions on older leaves caused by Alternaria, often promoted by warm, wet weather; remove crop debris and use protective fungicides.

Tomato___Late_blight.title: Tomato — Late blight
Tomato___Late_blight.description: Serious disease causing water-soaked lesions that rapidly progress; apply recommended fungicides and remove infected plants promptly.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.title: Tomato — Leaf mold
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Yellowing and olive-green fuzzy growth on leaf undersides in humid conditions; improve ventilation and use sulfur or copper treatments as appropriate.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.title: Tomato — Septoria leaf spot
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Small circular spots with gray centers caused by Septoria lycopersici; manage with sanitation, mulching, and fungicide sprays when needed.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.title: Tomato — Spider mites (Two-spotted)
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Tiny mites that cause stippling and webbing on leaves under hot, dry conditions; control with miticides or biological predators and increase humidity where feasible.

Tomato___Target_Spot.title: Tomato — Target spot
Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Leaf spots with concentric rings that can coalesce and defoliate plants; apply cultural controls and fungicides as recommended.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.title: Tomato — Tomato yellow leaf curl virus
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Virus transmitted by whiteflies causing leaf curling, yellowing and severe stunting; control whiteflies and remove infected plants to prevent spread.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.title: Tomato — Tomato mosaic virus
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Viral disease causing mottling and distortion of leaves and fruit; remove infected plants and disinfect tools and hands after handling.

Tomato___healthy.title: Tomato — Healthy
Tomato___healthy.description: No visible disease symptoms. Continue best practices for watering, feeding, and ventilation.

default.title: Unknown Disease
default.description: A description for this class is not available. You can add an entry to this file with a `title`, `description`, and optional `sample_image` filename.
